page.title: 11Lost Facilities, Bridgham
page.content: Norfolk County Council's policy is to concentrate development within certain designated "growth" villages. East Harling (2 miles to our east) is such a village; Bridgham is too small to warrant such status, nor would most people want it. However, some concern has been expressed throughout the county in recent years, over the future of small villages such as ours, especially in view of the constant erosion of village facilities. During the last 20 years, this village has lost almost all its self sufficiency: in the early l960's, the pub closed; in the late l970's both Post Office and Primary School closed; in l984, the small shop was also lost. We still have our own milk delivery service and phone box. Fortnightly church services are still held, but for how much longer?
